channel.title: [BETA Release] SaltyCrack
channel.description:
As some of you hackers may know, both Invision Power Board, and SMF forums have reverted to "salting" their passwords. This prevents them from being cracked by rainbow tables, and most brute forcers. So, at this point, I've resorted to programming my own. Obviously, its going to be slower because of the fact that I have to hash 2-3 times for just one possible plaintext. It is, however, pretty much the only one of its kind out there now. I call it SaltyCrack.
[img]http://img362.imageshack.us/img362/551/scrackms9.png[/img]
Download: [url=http://www.upit.be/download.php?id=2395]Mirror 1[/url]
Sorry about the lack of a good GUI. I did this program at about 3 in the morning, and I wasn't concerned with looks. The next version will include number hybrids, multiple wordlists, and faster brute forcing.

item.title: [BETA Release] SaltyCrack
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Vipsta, post:9, topic:5105”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=6667.msg70039#msg70039 date=1153173749]

Mopar, you didn’t tell me it was a SHA-1 password. :o

whatever this version of forum uses, idk

pretty much impossible to crack is it not?
[/quote]

Not really, just need to change the way the hash is encrypted.[/quote]

but arent there a lot more possibilities?

Read full topic

item.title: [BETA Release] SaltyCrack
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Vipsta, post:1, topic:5105”]As some of you hackers may know, both Invision Power Board, and SMF forums have reverted to “salting” their passwords. This prevents them from being cracked by rainbow tables, and most brute forcers. So, at this point, I’ve resorted to programming my own. Obviously, its going to be slower because of the fact that I have to hash 2-3 times for just one possible plaintext. It is, however, pretty much the only one of its kind out there now. I call it SaltyCrack.

Download: Mirror 1

Sorry about the lack of a good GUI. I did this program at about 3 in the morning, and I wasn’t concerned with looks. The next version will include number hybrids, multiple wordlists, and faster brute forcing.[/quote]

lol vipsta, you obviously didnt test this

the hash for smf is 40 characters, your program will not allow that many to be entered, rendering it useless

Read full topic

item.title: [BETA Release] SaltyCrack
item.dc:creator: @Vipsta Vipsta
item.description:
@Vipsta wrote:

Scyther:

nice, how does it work exactly

You need to get the password hash and the password salt from the database, either by exploit or other means. Since you want plaintext, you put the salt and hash in my program and it will brute force it.

For IPB, the salts/hashes are in “members_converge”. As for SMF, I’m not sure, but I do know the salting method.

Also, vBulletin will be added with the next release.

Read full topic
